snippet: A couple pleaded guilty to campaign violations for having a nursing home and affiliated entities pay John G. Rowland $35,000 as a campaign consultant.
abstract: John G Rowland, three-term Republican governor of Connecticut who resigned in 2004 under a cloud of corruption charges, is implicated in a new investigation of improper campaign financing; Lisa Wilson-Foley, Republican candidate in the Fifth Congressional District in 2012, and her husband Brian Foley plead guilty to campaign violations for having a nursing home and affiliated entities pay Rowland $35,000 as a campaign consultant.
lead_paragraph: A couple pleaded guilty to campaign violations for having a nursing home and affiliated entities pay John G. Rowland $35,000 as a campaign consultant.

headline.main: Rowland, Ex-Connecticut Governor, Is Implicated in New Case
headline.print_headline: Ex-Governor Is Implicated in New Case in Connecticut
